17 July 2008 |- ! |- ! colspan="2" style="text-align: center" | ''â'' [[2007â08 Manchester City F.C. season|2007â08]] {{0}} {{0}} {{0}} [[File:Soccerball current event.svg|30px]] {{0}} {{0}} {{0}} [[2009â10 Manchester City F.C. season|2009â10]] ''â'' |} {| class="infobox" cellspacing="5" style="width: 29em; font-size: 90%; text-align: center;" | colspan="5" style="font-size: 130%; font-weight: bold;" | Results summary - all competitions |- !style="width:20%"| !!style="width:20%"|Wins!!style="width:20%"|Draws!!style="width:20%"|Losses!!style="width:20%"|Win % |- |'''Home'''||19||1 ||8 ||67.9% |- |'''Away'''||6 ||7 ||15||21.4% |- |'''Both'''||25||8 ||23||44.6% |} {| class="infobox" cellspacing="5" style="width: 29em; font-size: 90%; text-align: center;" | colspan="5" style="font-size: 130%; font-weight: bold;" | Results summary - Premier League |- !style="width:20%"| !!style="width:20%"|Wins!!style="width:20%"|Draws!!style="width:20%"|Losses!!style="width:20%"|Win % |- |'''Home'''||13||0 ||6 ||68.4% |- |'''Away'''||2 ||5 ||12||10.5% |- |'''Both'''||15||5 ||18||39.5% |} The [[2008â09 in English football|'''2008â09 season''']] was [[Manchester City F.C.|'''Manchester City Football Club''']]'s seventh consecutive season playing in the [[Premier League]], the top division of [[Football in England|English football]], and its twelfth season since the Premier League was first created with Manchester City as one of the its original 22 founding member clubs. Overall, it was the team's 117th season playing in a division of English [[Association football|football]], most of which have been spent in the top flight. == Season review == The club started the season under the private ownership of UK Sports Investments Limited (UKSIL), a company controlled by former Thailand prime minister [[Thaksin Shinawatra]], but it was announced on the morning of Monday 1 September 2008 (the last day of the summer transfer window) that [[Abu Dhabi]]-based [[Abu Dhabi United Group|Abu Dhabi United Group Investment and Development Limited]] (ADUG) had completed a takeover of Manchester City in a deal worth a reported Â£200 million. This transaction made HH Sheikh [[Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan]] the new owner of the club, although initially he kept a very low profile and Dr. [[Sulaiman Al-Fahim]], who was the board member of ADUG that had presided over the signing of the deal at the [[Emirates Palace]] Hotel, was widely believed to be the new owner and potential chairman of the club. However, before the takeover was finally completed, wealthy backer Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan became more prominent and it was eventually made clear that Al-Fahim would not be joining the board at Manchester City, with [[Khaldoon Al Mubarak]] being appointed as the club's new chairman. {{cite news | url = http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/m/man_city/7593936.stm | title = Arabian might at Eastlands | date = 2008-09-02 | accessdate = 2010-11-16 | work = BBC Sport | publisher = British Broadcasting Corporation | first=Simon | last=Austin }} The last-minute takeover of the club on transfer "deadline-day" was then further capped, only minutes before the summer transfer window closed, with the news that the club had pipped Chelsea to the signing of [[RÃ³bson de Souza|Robinho]] from [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] for a [[Progression of British football transfer record|British record transfer fee]] of Â£32.5 million. {{cite news | title = City beat Chelsea to sign Â£32.5m Robinho | url = http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/2008/sep/02/manchestercity.chelsea1 | date=2008-09-02 | accessdate=2010-11-16 | work = guardian.co.uk | publisher = Guardian News and Media Limited | location=London | first=Daniel | last=Taylor }} {{Expand section | date=November 2010}} == Team kit == For this season the shirt sponsor for all of the club's kits continued to be the previous season's sponsor, [[Thomas Cook Group|Thomas Cook]], while the team kits were produced by the previous season's supplier, [[Le Coq Sportif]]. The home and away kits were unveiled by the club on 27 June 2008, with the new away kit representing a more modern rendition of the club's highly popular red and black striped shirts and black shorts that had first been introduced as a club kit by [[Malcolm Allison]] back in 1968 in imitation of [[A.C. Milan]]'s classic colors.{{cite news | url=http://www.epltalk.com/new-0809-manchester-city-home-away-shirts-unveiled/2512 | title=New season home and away strips unveiled | date=2008-06-27 | accessdate=2010-11-07 | publisher=epltalk.com }} A striking new bright orange and dark blue kit was also introduced as the club's third colours, whilst the team's main home strip shed the previous season's thin white vertical stripes from the shirts and returned to the solid sky blue shirts that are more traditionally associated with the team. As well as all three of the team kits being new this season, the previous season's green goalkeeper strip was also replaced with two new strips for the stoppers. The main GK strip, intended primarily for use with the home team colours, sported an all gold shirt trimmed with black on the shoulders and sides with matching all black shorts and socks, whilst a second all light green strip, with the shirts similarly trimmed in black, was introduced to supplement it on both home and away fixtures. {| border="0" |{{Football kit box | align = none center |
